title: CoI-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Asynchronous Online STEM Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational STEM Education Theory and Experience with Online Learning Platforms
context.additional_context: STEM education design training for pre-service and in-service teachers, applying the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework in asynchronous environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to design cognitive, social, and teaching presences in asynchronous discussions using the Community of Inquiry (CoI) framework.
Learners can propose at least three strategies for designing asynchronous STEM activities that minimize cognitive load, referencing the NASA-TLX tool.
Learners can demonstrate the process of analyzing interaction patterns in discussion posts and generating feedback using Python-based data analysis.

resources: Open-Source Tools for STEM Education (e.g., Jupyter Notebook)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
